channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Weed Clearing, 28th July
item.description:
Hi I live at 79 Linden Avenue, Prestbury, GL52 3DT. As you can see from the attached photo, the bay, outside the boundaries of my property, desperately needs clearing. I lived here for 2o years, I’ve done it myself, as any street sweeping vehicle, doesn’t attempt to ever clear it. Because I have long Covid, I’m no longer able to do this nor is it my responsibility anyway. Please have it cleared ASAP-. Thanks Steve

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Broadway Close, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Second noisy cover in Alma Road, 28th July
item.description:
This is the second cover, outside No42 Alma Road, not the one that has been reported for many months. Both covers rattle very loudly when a vehicle passes over them, and are a very serious noise nuisance to the residents. I am reporting this second cover now, in the hope that it can be repaired at the same time as the cover by No51, before it gets as loud.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 42, Alma Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road markings confusing and causing confusion, 28th July
item.description:
Two issues, 1) people keep getting in the left hand lane to go right - right is the last exit from the roundabout. 2) people are going straight on from the right lane - roundabout only has one lane exiting second exit but both lanes coming from KFC have straight on arrows. The signage is confusing and the cause of many arguments. The old markings are still on the road for where the previous entrance to the park and ride was. From Hatherley lane (KFC) there is no sensible reason why left lane should go right. This can easily be resolved by changing the arrow in the right hand lane to a right arrow and adding another set of arrows on the approach. It may be worth considering an angled arrow on the roundabout by the park and ride markings

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road marking and stud issues

item.title: Overgrown hedge blocking pavement, 27th July
item.description:
The pavement between Seven Posts Alley and the Prestbury playing field is blocked in a number of places by an overgrown hedge and vegetation. Folk are having to walk in the busy main road, which is extremely dangerous. Wheel chairs and buggies cannot use the pavement at all.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 269a, Prestbury Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham
